data.text: RT @ChrisJBakke: Normal VC events: “We’re hosting an SVP of UX from Microsoft for a 45 minute fireside chat in an office building in SOMA.…

retweeted_tweet.text:
Normal VC events: “We’re hosting an SVP of UX from Microsoft for a 45 minute fireside chat in an office building in SOMA. Water will be served.”

Every event thrown by a Founders Fund partner: “We’re throwing a 1920s Murder Mystery. A masked delivery driver will assign you your character 6 weeks in advance. We expect time period appropriate attire. Meet at this warehouse in the Mission. We’ll randomly have a Master Sommelier in attendance to handle wine pairings. There is a casino and you can gamble real money as part of the game. Also we need you to sign this waiver in case a murder actually occurs. We start at 6pm and end when we end.”

The NYT had an exclusive on the OAI funding round.
- OpenAI has raised $8.3 billion at a $300 billion valuation, months ahead of schedule
- The round was five times over subscribed 
- ARR is now $13 billion, up from $10 billion in June projected to surpass $20 billion by EOY
- business users who pay for ChatGPT has reached five million, up from three million a few months ago

data.text: looking for a quantum computing analyst to work with me on stocks & various other projects. ideal candidate has deep understanding of math/physics, strong qiskit/qasm/pennylane experience & wants to join the wild world of wall street. an interest in cryptography is a huge plus
RT @CraigGidney: The first novel thing I did in quantum computing was find a way add +1 to a register using O(1) space and O(n) gates. For…

retweeted_tweet.text:
The first novel thing I did in quantum computing was find a way add +1 to a register using O(1) space and O(n) gates. For 10 years I've wanted to know how to generalize that from x+=1 to x+=C... and I finally figured out a way to do it!

profile_bio.description: Programmer turned research scientist on Google's quantum computing team. Maker of Quirk, a fun drag-and-drop quantum circuit simulator ( https://t.co/oeUjGvPHCv ).

data.text:
i think its about right. there's just not that many companies growing that fast who are public, so there is a premium

40-50x+ revenue makes sense for 40-50%+ y/y growth (PLTR, FIG)
20-30x revs for 30%+ y/y growth (NET, APP, DUOL)
15x revs for 20-25% growth (DDOG, SNOW)
